adverbs.description: spruntly (comparative more spruntly, superlative most spruntly)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) In a sprunt manner; youthfully; neatly; becomingly.
examples: 1616,  Jonson, Ben,  The Devil Is an Ass, act 4, scene 1:How do I look to-day, am I not drest Spruntly? [Looks in her glass]
